availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Tenth governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, politician and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Nancy Mason. Father of William Melville Metcalfe, Rhoda D. Metcalfe, Bela Metcalfe, Jane Lee Metcalfe, Jacob R. Metcalfe, Keturah Gruelle Metcalfe, Leonidas Metcalfe, and Mary A. Metcalfe. Served in the United States House of Representatives from 1819 to 1828. Elected governor of Kentucky in 1828 and served until 1832. Served in the United States Senate from 1848 to 1849, replacing John J. Crittenden. Resident of Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 393A.
Appletons' Cyclopedia of American Biography, 1600-1889, Vol. 4 (New York: D. Appleton and Company, 1888), p. 312.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Metcalfe (1780-1855)," Memorial #7909145, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7909145 (accessed May 5, 2020).
